DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the plasma cell myeloma stage defined according to the Revised International Staging System (RISS) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)_A plasma cell myeloma stage defined according to the Revised International Staging System (RISS) criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: A plasma cell myeloma stage defined according to the Revised International Staging System (RISS) criteria.

Concepts.definition: A plasma cell myeloma stage defined according to the Revised International Staging System (RISS) criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: RISS Stage II Plasma Cell Myeloma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: RISS Stage II Plasma Cell Myeloma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stage I or III. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Not stage I or III. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: RISS Stage III Plasma Cell Myeloma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: RISS Stage III Plasma Cell Myeloma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Serum beta-2-microglobulin 5.5 mg/L or more and high-risk cytogenetics and/or high LDH. High risk cytogenetics consist of one or more of the following: del17p, t(4;14), or t(14;16). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Serum beta-2-microglobulin 5.5 mg/L or more and high-risk cytogenetics and/or high LDH. High risk cytogenetics consist of one or more of the following: del17p, t(4;14), or t(14;16). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: RISS Stage I Plasma Cell Myeloma

ValueMeaning.preferredName: RISS Stage I Plasma Cell Myeloma
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Serum beta-2-microglobulin less than 3.5 mg/L and serum albumin 3.5 g/dL or more and no high-risk cytogenetics and normal LDH. High risk cytogenetics consist of one or more of the following: del17p, t(4;14), or t(14;16). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Serum beta-2-microglobulin less than 3.5 mg/L and serum albumin 3.5 g/dL or more and no high-risk cytogenetics and normal LDH. High risk cytogenetics consist of one or more of the following: del17p, t(4;14), or t(14;16). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ReferenceDocuments.name: Revised International Staging
ReferenceDocuments.description: Revised International Staging System (R-ISS) Stage at Diagnosis/Study Entry

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
